title: Van Loan Hill
text:
Van Loan Hill is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in <a href="Greene%20County%2C%20New%20York">Greene County, New York</a>. It is located in the <a href="Catskill%20Mountains">Catskill Mountains</a> southwest of <a href="Maplecrest%2C%20New%20York">Maplecrest</a>. <a href="Round%20Hill%20%28Greene%20County%2C%20New%20York%29">Round Hill</a> is located west, <a href="Elm%20Ridge%20%28Greene%20County%2C%20New%20York%29">Elm Ridge</a> is located north-northeast, and <a href="East%20Jewett%20Range">East Jewett Range</a> is located south of Van Loan Hill.
Van Loan Hill is a <a href="drumlin">drumlin</a> that was formed in the <a href="Last%20Glacial%20Period">Last Glacial Period</a>. Its name is possibly in honor of <a href="Walton%20Van%20Loan">Walton Van Loan</a>, a local <a href="guide%20book">guide book</a> author and <a href="Cartography">cartographer</a>.
On <a href="National%20Trails%20Day">National Trails Day</a> in 1999, an adjacent parcel of <a href="Drainage%20basin">watershed</a> land called Maplecrest Unit in the <a href="Windham%20%28town%29%2C%20New%20York">Town of Windham</a> was opened for hiking by the <a href="New%20York%20City%20Department%20of%20Environmental%20Protection">New York City Department of Environmental Protection</a>, allowing for unobstructed views. To view by car, the closest road to the north and east is <a href="County%20Route%2040%20%28Greene%20County%2C%20New%20York%29">County Route 40</a>. To the south is Round Hills Road, and to the west past Round Hill is <a href="New%20York%20State%20Route%20296">New York State Route 296</a>. <a href="Batavia%20Kill%20%28Schoharie%20Creek%20tributary%29">Batavia Kill</a> runs along the northern slope, and the tributaries of <a href="East%20Kill">East Kill</a> lie south. The area was in the path of both <a href="Hurricane%20Irene">Hurricane Irene</a> and <a href="Tropical%20Storm%20Lee%20%282011%29">Tropical Storm Lee</a>, and in 2012 the Maplecrest Unit underwent restoration work and stream stabilization.
